frameDefinitions: Through a  Message, a Speaker (sometimes encoded metonymically by a Medium) communicates the relative importance of the state of affairs denoted by the Message.
This frame consists of words that indicate the change of an Item's position on a scale (the Attribute) from a starting point (Initial_value) to an end point (Final_value).
An Item which encompasses characteristics or types whose diversity is indicated by adducing a Limit1 and a Limit2 which differ considerably from each other.
The size of an Entity is assessed in terms of the Degree by which it deviates from the norm.
This frame contains words that describe an Item's static position on a scale with respect to some property Variable.  ''
This frame is about the static comparison of an Profiled_item to a Standard_item, often  with respect to some Attribute.
frameExamples: Reid <t>emphasized</t> that he and Dean meet every month.
Hawke's Bay winery <t>doubled</t> in size last year.
Dried fruits are especially <t>high</t> in fibre, as are pulses.
The Sun is putting on a show that <t>rivals</t> the most sizzling Hollywood thrillers.
listRoleDefinitions: The person who uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey a <fen>Message</fen> to another person.
The proposition whose denotation the Speaker presents as important.
The physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
The time at which the <fen>Speaker</fen> communicates a <fen>Message</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Speaker</fen> delivers the <fen>Message</fen>.
The <fen>Attribute</fen> is a scalar property that the <fen>Item</fen> possesses.
The entity that has a position on the scale.
The distance by which an <fen>Item</fen> changes its position on the scale.
The position on the scale where the <fen>Item</fen> ends up.
The initial position on the scale from which the <fen>Item</fen> moves away.
A portion of the scale, typically identified by its end points, along which the values of the <fen>Attribute</fen> fluctuate.
A description that presents the <fen>Item</fen>'s state before the change in the <fen>Attribute</fen>'s value as an independent predication.
A description that presents the <fen>Item</fen>'s state after  the change in the <fen>Attribute</fen>'s value as an independent predication.
The <fen>Time</fen> is the time-frame in which the change of position occurs.
A location where Attribute is measured
The entity whose scalar property is specified.
The scalar property that the <fen>Item</fen> possesses.
The first-mentioned possibility of the range of variation.
The second item of the range of variation.
The range of positions on the scale that the <fen>Item</fen> occupies.
The thing whose size is being considered.
The feature of an (actual or possible) <fen>Entity</fen> that is measured. In literal examples, it essentially must be size, or a word equivalent to size such as bulk.
<fen>Item</fen> identifies the entity whose scalar property is specified.

<fen>Variable</fen> is the scalar property that the <fen>Item</fen> possesses.

<fex name='Item'>Soda</fex> is <t>high</t> <fex name='Variable'>in sugar</fex>.
The <fen>Value</fen> is the position or range of positions on the scale that the Item occupies.  This is normally implicit in the LU.
In active sentences, the <fen>Profiled_item</fen> is the grammatically more prominent one of the items that are compared and realized as  the subject. .
In active setnnces, the <fen>Standard_item</fen> is  the grammatically less prominent element, i.e. the object or an oblique.
This Frame Elements marks constituents that indicate in which respect Item-1 and Item-2 are equal to each other.
The <fen>Standard_attribute</fen> is used when the standard is a specific value on  a scale.
The <fen>Profiled_attribute</fen> is a particular value on a scale which is being compared to a <fen>Standard_item</fen> or <fen>Profiled_attribute</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Profiled_item</fen> rivals the <fen>Standard_item</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Profiled_item</fen> rivals the <fen>Standard_item</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Juhl</fex> emphasized the importance of UPMC System investments, stating that their contribution to the school's funds had tripled in recent years.
He emphasized to me <fex>that my words will go down in history and that this poem has made a difference in our world</fex>.
<fex>The report</fex> emphasized that Iraq's unwillingness to cooperate represents a serious problem for the progress of this work.
However, Cockerill stressed <fex>last week</fex> that he had had many meetings about these obvious synergies and that he had pursued these aggressively.
Putin stressed <fex>in Beijing</fex> that Russia does not favor independence for Taiwan.
Oil rose <fex>in price</fex> by 2%.
I fear <fex>this service</fex> will diminish in quality.
Oil rose in price <fex>by 2%</fex>.
Microsoft shares fell <fex>to 7 5/8</fex>.
Microsoft shares fell <fex>from 12 3/8</fex> to 7 5/8.
The patient's temperature fluctuated <fex>between 28.5 and 29.5</fex>.
Diesels have increased <fex>from having a 20% market share in 1995</fex> to just over 30% in 2004.

It was never bad (1 or 2 seizures a year), but this past decade, it has increased
<fex>to having them 1 day a month</fex> and on that 1 day I have 6 or 7 seizures.
Prices range <fex>between 10 and 20 dollars</fex>.
I had a big <fex>dinner</fex>.
The particles were smaller <fex>in size</fex> than expected .
<fex>Bacon</fex> is high in fat.
This car is <fex><t>high</t></fex> in price.
<fex>This PC</fex> stacks up well against its competitors
This PC stacks up well <fex>against its competitors</fex>
The Tri-Cities stack up well against the competition <fex>in the area of innovation</fex>
We equalled <fex>father's skills</fex> .
American caviar <fex>now</fex> rivals Russia's in quality.
<fex>In Africa</fex>, the level of drug resistance rivals even Noatirtin's vaunted efficacy.
